newsitem.title: ESTONIA: Estonian shares ease slightly, volume down.
newsitem.headline: Estonian shares ease slightly, volume down.

text.p: Estonian shares eased a bit on Monday and volume fell considerably, the Tallinn bourse said.
The Tallinn stock exchange index edged down by 0.07 percent to 186.23 in trade of 10.4 million kroons, down from Friday's turnover of 25.2 million kroons.

Market leader Hansapank was the most active listing in trade of 3.5 million kroons but its share price showed little reaction to Monday's news that its consolidated 1996 profit was 297.3 million kroons, a rise of more than 70 percent.
Its share price closed unchanged at 176.25 kroons.
Tallinn Pank bounced back after a recent slide, closing at 62.55 kroons versus 62.45 kroons on Friday in trade of almost 1.9 million kroons.
Forex Pank closed down at 146.55 kroons versus 147.50 kroons on Friday in trade of 1.37 million kroons.
Volume on the over-the-counter market was also down on Monday, dipping to 3.48 million kroons from 7.5 million kroons on Friday.
